title: Raghuveera Gadyam (The Prose-Poem of Raghuveera)
author: Vedanta Desika (Swamy Desikan)
introduction: The Raghuveera Gadyam is a famous Sanskrit prayer that narrates the entire story of Lord Rāma (Raghuveera) in a continuous, flowing prose style (Gadyam), often employing highly elaborate and descriptive compound words. It begins with the invocation 'Jayati' (Victory to) and ends with a description of the final coronation (Pattabhishekam). It is renowned for its literary brilliance and devotional fervor.

chapters.name: The Victory of Raghuveera (Jayati Vākya)
chapters.summary: This chapter covers the entire narrative of Lord Rama, from his lineage and divine birth to the climax of the Ramayana—his coronation and eternal reign.

verses.original:
जयति आश्रितसंस्त्रास-ध्वंसन-प्रकृष्टिः,
विषह्य-पराक्रम-धनम्, सत्य-सन्धम्, धर्म-धामम्, निगमान्त-सार-सौख्यम्, जानकी-सहितम् रघुवीरम् ॥
verses.transliteration:
jayati āśritasaṁstrāsa-dhvaṁsana-prakṛṣṭiḥ,
viṣahya-parākrāma-dhanam, satya-sandham, dharma-dhāmam, nigamānta-sāra-saukhyam, jānakī-sahitaṁ raghuvīram ||

translations.english: Victory to Raghuveera (Rāma) who excels in destroying the fears of those who take refuge in him, whose wealth is his invincible valor, who is pledged to truth, the abode of Dharma, the essence and happiness of the Vedas, and who is ever united with Jānakī (Sītā).
Victory to Raghuveera, the ultimate limit of all worlds' victory and happiness, the son of Daśaratha, who possesses supreme and eternal glory and wealth.

Victory to Raghuveera, who received the famed great and heroic Mantras (Bala-Atibala), the beloved of Viśvāmitra, and the cause of the auspicious marriage of the daughter of the King of Mithilā (Sītā).
Victory to Raghuveera, clever in crushing the arrogance of Bhārgava (Paraśurāma), the ornament of the Kṣatriya lineage, endowed with incomparable happiness and abundant wealth.
Victory to Raghuveera, who entrusted the kingdom to Bharata, who was initiated into fulfilling Kaikeyī's boon, and who was accompanied by Sītā and Lakṣmaṇa.
Victory to Raghuveera, who traversed the Daṇḍaka forest, who vanquished the demon Virādha, and who obtained the grace of the sages Śarabhaṅga and Sutīkṣṇa.
Victory to Raghuveera, who dwelled in a hut on the banks of the Godāvarī, who mutilated Śūrpaṇakhā at Pañcavaṭī, and who was terrifying in his slaying of Khara, Dūṣaṇa, Triśira, and others.

Victory to Raghuveera, who put to flight the illusion of the golden deer (Mārīca), who was afflicted with sorrow over Sītā’s abduction, and who was skilled in granting release from the curse to Kabandha.
Victory to Raghuveera, who was pleased by the obeisance of Śabarī, who established friendship with Hanumān and Sugrīva, and who was righteous in punishing Vāli.
Victory to Raghuveera, who rested during the rainy season, who vowed to find the separated Sītā, and who was delighted by praising the valor of Hanumān.
Victory to Raghuveera, who conducted the sacred counsel on the seashore, who was righteous in granting refuge to Vibhīṣaṇa, and whose valor bound the waters of the ocean.
Victory to Raghuveera, the establisher of the bridge (Setu), who was ready for the conquest of Laṅkā, and the killer of Dhūmrākṣa, Akampana, Meghanāda (Indrajit), and others.
Victory to Raghuveera, who was delighted by the killing of Kumbhakarṇa and Nikumbha, whose great valor cut off Rāvaṇa's heads, and who caused sorrow to Mandodarī (Rāvaṇa's wife).

Victory to Raghuveera, who attained joy upon the establishment of Sītā's chastity (Pātivratya), who was consecrated to grant the kingdom to Vibhīṣaṇa, and who enjoyed the comfort of ascending the Puṣpaka aircraft.
Victory to Raghuveera, who was lauded for his love by Bharata, who was bound by the promise to protect Kiṣkindhā and Laṅkā, and who presided over the grand festival of entering the city of Ayodhyā.
Victory to Raghuveera, the recipient of blessings from sages like Vasiṣṭha, surrounded by Sītā, Lakṣmaṇa, Bharata, and Śatrughna, and who was crowned at Nandigrāma (before the main coronation).
Victory to Raghuveera, who was delighted by the completion of his fourteen-year vow, who received new teachings from the sages, and who is the King of all Kings.

Victory to Raghuveera, who is skilled in protecting the cycle of the entire universe, the establisher of all righteous principles (Dharma), and who attained the happiness that is the union with supreme bliss.
Victory to Raghuveera, who shines with the side-glance of Goddess Sītā, who is united with Lakshmī, and who grants the four kinds of human endeavors (Dharma, Artha, Kāma, Mokṣa).
Victory to Raghuveera, the protector of infinite universes, the guardian of the people of Ayodhyā, and who is worshipped by the entire empire of prosperity.

verses.original: जयति दाशरथिं रामम्... पर-ब्रह्म-रूपम्, धर्म-स्थापकम्, अखिल-लोक-रक्षकम् रघुवीरम् ॥
verses.transliteration: jayati dāśarathiṁ rāmam... para-brahma-rūpam, dharma-sthāpakam, akhila-loka-rakṣakam raghuvīram ||

translations.english: Victory to Rāma, the son of Daśaratha, who is the form of the Supreme Brahman, the establisher of Dharma, and the protector of all worlds.

verses.original: जयति राज-राजेश्वरम् रामभद्रम्, सीता-हृदय-कमल-विहारिणम्... नित्य-कल्याण-गुण-शालीम् रघुवीरम् ॥
verses.transliteration: jayati rāja-rājeśvaram rāmabhadram, sītā-hṛdaya-kamala-vihāriṇam... nitya-kalyāṇa-guṇa-śālīm raghuvīram ||

translations.english: Victory to Rāmabhadra, the King of Kings, who sports in the lotus heart of Sītā, and who is endowed with eternally auspicious qualities.

verses.original: जयति वीर-वरम्, श्री-वैकुण्ठ-नाथम्, अपरिच्छिन्न-आनन्द-स्वरूपम्... सत्य-ज्ञानानन्द-घनाम् रघुवीरम् ॥
verses.transliteration: jayati vīra-varam, śrī-vaikuṇṭha-nātham, aparicchinna-ānanda-svarūpam... satya-jñānānanda-ghanām raghuvīram ||

translations.english: Victory to the foremost hero, the Lord of Śrī Vaikuṇṭha, whose nature is boundless bliss, and who is the embodiment of truth, knowledge, and bliss (Sat-Cit-Ānanda).

verses.original: जयति त्रयी-सङ्गतम्, सर्व-वेदान्त-सारम्, लक्ष्मीनारायणम्... रामचन्द्र-मूर्तिम् रघुवीरम् ॥
verses.transliteration: jayati trayī-saṅgatam, sarva-vedānta-sāram, lakṣmīnārāyaṇam... rāmacandra-mūrtim raghuvīram ||

translations.english: Victory to Raghuveera, the embodiment of the three Vedas, the essence of all Vedānta, the form of Lakṣmīnārāyaṇa, the divine image of Rāmacandra.

verses.original: जयति सीता-पति-कल्याणम्, नित्यम् नित्यम् मङ्गळम्... श्रीमान् वेङ्कटनाथार्य-रचितम् रघुवीर-गद्यम् ॥
verses.transliteration: jayati sītā-pati-kalyāṇam, nityam nityam maṅgaḷam... śrīmān veṅkaṭanāthārya-racitam raghuvīra-gadyam ||

translations.english: Victory to the welfare of the Lord of Sītā, eternal and ever auspicious; thus ends the Raghuveera Gadyam composed by the venerable Veṅkaṭanāthārya (Vedānta Deśika).

verses.original:
इति श्रीमद्-वेदान्त-देशिक-विरचितं
श्रीमद्-रघुवीर-गद्यं सम्पूर्णम् ।
फलश्रुति: य: इदम् नित्यम् पठति स: सर्वान् कामान् अवाप्नोति ।
verses.transliteration:
iti śrīmad-vedānta-deśika-viracitaṁ
śrīmad-raghuvīra-gadyaṁ sampūrṇam |
phalaśruti: ya: idam nityam paṭhati sa: sarvān kāmān avāpnōti |

translations.english: Thus ends the glorious Raghuveera Gadyam composed by the illustrious Vedānta Deśika. (Phalaśruti - Benefit of Recitation): He who recites this daily attains all his desires.
